tagline: rubygem to keep a check at your ThoughtWorks' Go Continuous Integration Server from console
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
name: ci-go-nfo
body:
Blog: [http://justfewtuts.blogspot.in/2012/09/ci-go-nfo-v001-console-util-for.html](http://justfewtuts.blogspot.in/2012/09/ci-go-nfo-v001-console-util-for.html)

Just a rubygem console utility to get focussed INFO about your Go Continuous Integration pipeline easily, no more switching again to browsers.

@RubyGems: [https://rubygems.org/gems/ci-go-nfo](https://rubygems.org/gems/ci-go-nfo)

@GitHub:  [https://github.com/abhishekkr/ci-go-nfo](https://github.com/abhishekkr/ci-go-nfo)


## Installation 

$ gem install ci-go-nfo


## Usage Ci-Go-Nfo ver.0.0.1 

to set-up credential config for your go-ci
* $ ci-go-nfo setup

it asks for
(a.) the location where you want to store your configuration file
(b.) the URL for your Go Server like http://my.go.server:8153
(c.) then username and password (create a read-only a/c for it) 

to show go-ci info of all runs
* $ ci-go-nfo

to show go-ci info of failed runs
* $ ci-go-nfo fail

to show go-ci info of passed runs
* $ ci-go-nfo pass

_____

.....more to come
